title: Reassembalge
description:
MOVIE INFORMATION

Movie Title: Reassemblage
Directed, Photographed, Written & Edited by: Trinh T. Minh-ha
Producer:  Jean-Paul Bourdier
Film negative format: 16 mm
Keywords: Reflexive documentary, meta-documentary, reflexive etnographic film, feminist cinema.
Running Time: 39 Minutes
Country: United States 


ABOUT THE DIRECTOR

Trinh T. Minh-ha is a filmmaker, writer, academic and composer.

She has been making films for over twenty years and may be best known for her first film Reassemblage, made in 1982. Her more recent film Surname Viet, Given Name Nam (1989), examines "identity and culture through the struggle of Vietnamese women," and has received much attention, including winning the Blue Ribbon Award at the American Film and Video festival.

Trinh T. Minh-ha is Professor of Women&#039;s Studies and Rhetoric (Film) at the University of California, Berkeley.

ABOUT THE DIRECTOR

Trinh T. Minh-ha is a filmmaker, writer, academic and composer.

She has been making films for over twenty years and may be best known for her first film Reassemblage, made in 1982. Her more recent film Surname Viet, Given Name Nam (1989), examines "identity and culture through the struggle of Vietnamese women," and has received much attention, including winning the Blue Ribbon Award at the American Film and Video festival.

Trinh T. Minh-ha is Professor of Women&#039;s Studies and Rhetoric (Film) at the University of California, Berkeley.



MOVIE SYNOPSIS


From Allmovie:

Director Trinh T. Minh-ha&#039;s first film is an ethnographic portrait of rural Senegalese women, but its provocative editing and self-conscious narration question the very activities of ethnography and documentary filmmaking; Minh-ha inverts and critiques authoritative Western representations of the "other.&#039;" ~ Sarah Welsh, All Movie Guide
